formalized_text: The system shall be implemented using a Client-Server architecture, consisting of a WPF desktop client application for all user interactions and a single, consolidated background Windows Service for asynchronous and long-running tasks.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall be architected as a Client-Server system with a decoupled Background Worker Service. The system shall be composed of a main WPF desktop client application for user interaction and a single, consolidated background Windows Service.

formalized_text: The system shall depend on pre-installed and configured instances of a PostgreSQL server (version 16) and a RabbitMQ server for its operation. The application will not bundle these services for production deployment.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: This architecture requires pre-existing and configured server components (PostgreSQL, RabbitMQ) for operation.

formalized_text: The background Windows Service shall be the sole host for all asynchronous, long-running tasks. Its responsibilities must include: acting as the DICOM C-STORE SCP listener, consuming messages from a queue for database write operations, processing all PDF generation jobs, and handling the spooling of physical print jobs.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The background service shall be responsible for hosting all background functionalities and processing asynchronous, long-running tasks, including but not limited to: Acting as the C-STORE SCP listener. Consuming messages from a queue for database writes originating from C-STORE operations. Processing PDF generation requests. Handling physical print job spooling.

formalized_text: All communication for asynchronous task initiation from the WPF client to the Windows Service shall be performed using a message queue implemented with RabbitMQ. The client acts as the producer and the service acts as the consumer.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Communication between the main application (producer) and the background service (consumer) for asynchronous tasks shall be handled via a message queue (RabbitMQ).

formalized_text: Messages published to RabbitMQ for critical operations, including database writes and print jobs, shall be marked as persistent. The corresponding queues shall be declared as durable to ensure that messages are not lost in the event of a RabbitMQ broker restart.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: All messages published to RabbitMQ for critical data processing (e.g., database writes, print jobs) shall be marked as persistent to ensure they survive a message broker restart.

formalized_text: The RabbitMQ architecture shall implement a dead-letter exchange (DLX) and dead-letter queue (DLQ) mechanism. Messages that fail processing a configurable number of times in the main queue shall be automatically routed to the DLQ for manual inspection and intervention.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The message queue architecture shall include a dead-letter queue (DLQ) mechanism to handle and isolate messages that fail processing after a configurable number of retries.

formalized_text: The system shall use Named Pipes for direct, synchronous, inter-process communication between the WPF client and the Windows Service. This channel shall be used exclusively for real-time status checks, such as verifying the service's operational status.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Direct, synchronous communication for real-time status checks (e.g., verifying if the service is running) shall be handled via Named Pipes.

formalized_text: The entire system, including the WPF client and the Windows Service, shall be developed using the .NET 8 framework and the C# 12 programming language. The desktop client's user interface shall be built with Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF).
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall be developed using the .NET 8 framework, C# programming language, and Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF).

formalized_text: The system shall exclusively use the `fo-dicom` library for all DICOM-related functionalities, including but not limited to C-STORE, C-FIND, C-MOVE, metadata parsing, and image rendering.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall use the `fo-dicom` library for all DICOM operations.

formalized_text: The system shall use PostgreSQL as its database for storing study metadata. To accommodate high-volume C-STORE operations, the C-STORE SCP listener (in the background service) shall not write directly to the database. Instead, it shall publish the received DICOM metadata as a message to a RabbitMQ queue. A separate, dedicated consumer process within the background service shall be responsible for reading from this queue and performing the database insertion.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall use PostgreSQL for the local data store to handle high-volume record insertion from modalities with large numbers of images per study. To ensure guaranteed and high-throughput data insertion, the C-STORE SCP service shall publish received study metadata to a message queue (RabbitMQ), which will be consumed by a separate process within the background service responsible for database writing.

formalized_text: The application must integrate with the Odoo Web Portal's REST API over HTTPS to perform license validation.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall integrate with the existing Odoo Web Portal APIs for license validation.

formalized_text: The system shall be designed, developed, and implemented in a manner that complies with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) Security and Privacy Rules. This includes all aspects of Protected Health Information (PHI) handling, access control, auditing, data encryption, and anonymization.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall be developed in accordance with the HIPAA Security Rule (45 CFR Part 160 and Subparts A and C of Part 164) and Privacy Rule for PHI handling, anonymization, and security.

formalized_text: The system shall be built using the following specific technology stack: .NET 8/C# 12, WPF with MVVM and Material Design in XAML Toolkit, Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting for Windows Services, Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection for DI, Named Pipes for synchronous IPC, RabbitMQ for asynchronous IPC, PostgreSQL 16 with Entity Framework Core 8, `fo-dicom` for DICOM, `Vortice.Windows` for high-performance rendering, Serilog for logging, QuestPDF for PDF generation, and a signed MSIX installer for deployment.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Technology Stack (REQ-TEC-003)

formalized_text: The system shall implement a Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) model to manage user permissions. Two roles shall be defined: 'Technician' and 'Administrator', each with a distinct set of permissions.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall enforce a role-based access control model with two distinct roles: Technician and Administrator.

formalized_text: A user with the 'Technician' role shall be granted permissions to perform all standard operational tasks, including viewing/searching studies, using all image manipulation tools (zoom, pan, WW/WL), creating/saving annotations, and using all print and export functions. The system must explicitly prevent a Technician from editing DICOM metadata, accessing any system configuration settings (PACS, Users, Storage), and viewing audit trails.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Technician Role Permissions: The system shall allow a Technician to view and search for studies... perform all viewing operations... create and save annotations... use all print and export functions... prevent a Technician from editing DICOM metadata... changing system settings... viewing audit trails.

formalized_text: A user with the 'Administrator' role shall have all permissions of the 'Technician' role, plus additional administrative privileges. An Administrator must be able to edit DICOM metadata, manage user accounts and roles, configure all system settings, and view and export audit trails.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Admin Role Permissions: The system shall grant an Admin all permissions of the Technician role... allow an Admin to edit DICOM metadata tags from a configurable list... manage user accounts and roles... configure all system, print, and network settings... view and export audit trails.

formalized_text: The system shall be designed to ensure that all PHI, including DICOM files and database records, can be stored and processed on infrastructure that resides within a geographical location specified by the deploying organization, without reliance on external cloud services for core data processing or storage.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Data Residency: All Protected Health Information (PHI) data, including DICOM files and database records, shall be stored and processed within the geographical boundaries specified by the deploying organization's legal and regulatory requirements.

formalized_text: The system shall implement a configurable data retention policy. An Administrator shall be able to configure an auto-purge rule to permanently delete studies and their associated data older than a specified period. The default retention period shall be 7 years. All auto-purge actions must be logged in the system audit trail, recording which studies were deleted and when.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Data Retention Policy: The system shall enforce a configurable data retention policy. By default, all study data shall be retained for a minimum of 7 years. An Administrator shall be able to configure auto-purge rules to permanently delete studies older than the defined retention period. This action must be logged in the audit trail.

formalized_text: To support security incident response, the system shall provide an Administrator with the following capabilities via the Administration dashboard: view a list of all currently active user sessions, force the immediate logout of any specific session, and disable any user account to prevent future logins.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Incident Response Support: The system shall provide capabilities to support security incident response. An Administrator shall have the ability to immediately disable any user account, force a logout of a specific user session, and view active sessions from the Administration dashboard.

formalized_text: The system shall provide a DICOM printing feature that utilizes the standard Windows Print API to print on any installed commercial printer. The installer must register and start the background Windows Service, which shall be named "DICOM Service". This service is responsible for detecting all printers available to the Windows operating system.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall provide a DICOM printing capability that integrates directly with the Windows Print API to enable printing on commercial inkjet/laser printers. The application installer shall register and start a consolidated Windows Service named "DICOM Service". The service shall automatically detect all system-installed printers.

formalized_text: Communication for printing shall be twofold: the client shall use a synchronous Named Pipe call to check the status of the 'DICOM Service', and if available, it shall submit a serialized print job object to a RabbitMQ queue for asynchronous processing. If the service status check fails, the 'Print' button in the UI must be disabled, and a non-blocking notification shall inform the user that the print service is unavailable.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The main desktop application shall communicate with the Windows Service via Named Pipes for synchronous status checks. The application shall submit a serialized print job object... to a message queue (RabbitMQ) for asynchronous processing... The application shall gracefully handle and notify the user... if the Windows Service is stopped... The "Print" button in the UI shall be disabled if the print service is not available...

formalized_text: The print preview interface shall provide a selection of predefined page layout templates, including 'Single image on A4', 'Single image on A3', '2x2 grid on A4', and '1+3 comparison on A3'. Additionally, it shall offer modality-specific layout presets, such as '1x1 for X-ray' and '4x4 for CT'.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The print preview UI shall provide predefined page templates: Single image (A4/A3), 2x2 grid (A4), and 1+3 comparison (A3). The print preview UI shall provide modality-specific presets, such as 1x1 for X-ray and 4x4 for CT slices.

formalized_text: The print preview interface shall allow users to configure the page layout with the following options: page margins (configurable from 5mm to 20mm), page orientation (Portrait or Landscape), and image scaling (Fit-to-Page or Actual Size).
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Users shall be able to customize page margins within a range of 5-20mm. Users shall be able to select page orientation (Portrait/Landscape). Users shall be able to select image scaling options: Fit-to-Page and Actual Size.

formalized_text: The system shall support a configurable auto-arrangement feature for print layouts. An Administrator must be able to define rules in the Settings page that map specific DICOM modalities to default print layouts and specify the sorting order of images within that layout (e.g., by Image Number).
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall support auto-arranging images on the print layout based on configurable rules. An Admin user shall be able to configure the rules for auto-arrangement in the Settings Page. The configuration shall allow mapping specific modalities to default layouts and defining the sorting order of images.

formalized_text: The print preview interface shall allow users to manually rearrange the order and position of images within the selected layout grid using a drag-and-drop interaction.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Users shall be able to manually rearrange images within the print preview grid via drag-and-drop.

formalized_text: The system shall allow users to add branding and overlays to the print output. This includes: uploading a custom logo (PNG/JPEG) with configurable position (Header, Footer, or X/Y coordinates) and scaling (10-50% of page width); and adding custom text fields with configurable font, size, and color. These text fields must support dynamic variables (e.g., `[PatientID]`, `[StudyDate]`) that are replaced with DICOM metadata at print time.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Users shall be able to upload a custom logo in PNG or JPEG format. The logo position shall be configurable to Header, Footer, or custom X/Y coordinates. Logo scaling shall be adjustable from 10% to 50% of the page width. Users shall be able to add custom text fields with configurable font, size, and color. Custom text fields shall support variables that are replaced at print time (e.g., `[PatientID]`, `[Date]`).

formalized_text: The system shall provide a non-destructive de-identification feature for printed output. Users shall be able to apply pixel-based blackout overlays (masks) in the print preview. These overlays must be applied only at print time and must not modify the original DICOM files. The system shall include pre-built overlay templates (e.g., 'Chest X-Ray De-ID') and support the creation of custom templates using rectangular and polygonal shapes.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall support non-destructive, print-time pixel-based overlay masks for de-identification. Applying a blackout overlay in the print preview shall not alter the original DICOM file on disk. The system shall provide pre-built templates for de-identification (e.g., Chest X-Ray De-ID). Overlay templates shall support configurable rectangular and polygonal regions.

formalized_text: An Administrator shall have access to an overlay template management interface within the Settings page. This interface must allow the Administrator to create new templates by drawing rectangular and polygonal regions on a sample image, save them with a name, and subsequently edit or delete existing templates.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall provide an interface for Admin users to manage overlay templates within the Settings Page. The interface shall allow an Admin user to create new overlay templates by drawing and saving rectangular/polygonal regions. Admin users shall be able to edit and delete existing templates.

formalized_text: The system shall provide an option to export the print layout as a PDF file. The generated file must be compliant with the PDF/A-3 standard. The export options shall include the ability to embed DICOM metadata within the PDF and to encrypt the PDF with a user-provided password using AES-256 encryption.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall generate a PDF file of the print layout. The generated PDF shall be PDF/A-3 compliant. The system shall provide an option to embed DICOM metadata into the PDF file. The system shall provide an option to password-protect the PDF using AES-256 encryption.

formalized_text: The system shall provide a feature to send the print output via email. An Administrator must be able to configure SMTP server settings (host, port, credentials, TLS/STARTTLS) in the Settings page. When sending, the user shall have the option to attach the output as a single PDF file or as individual image files in either JPEG or PNG format.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall be able to attach the print output as a PDF or image(s) to an email. The Settings Page shall provide fields to configure an SMTP server (host, port, credentials, TLS/STARTTLS). Users shall be able to attach the output as a single PDF or as individual image files. Exported images for email attachments shall be in a user-selectable format (JPEG/PNG).

formalized_text: The system shall support the creation and use of pre-filled email templates. These templates must allow for the inclusion of dynamic variables (e.g., `[PatientName]`, `[StudyDate]`) in the subject and body, which will be replaced with the corresponding study's DICOM metadata when the email is composed.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall allow the creation of pre-filled email templates with variables (e.g., `[PatientName]`, `[StudyDate]`).

formalized_text: Before sending an email, the system shall perform a security check. If the email body or subject contains PHI variables, or if any attachment is unsecured (e.g., a non-password-protected PDF, JPEG, or PNG file), the system must display a modal warning dialog. This dialog shall inform the user about the risk of sending unsecured PHI and require explicit confirmation before the email can be sent.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: As a business rule, if an email template is configured to include PHI variables or if an attached PDF is not password-protected, the system shall display a warning to the user about sending unsecured PHI before sending the email. ...the system shall display a modal dialog with a warning message that requires explicit user confirmation to proceed.

formalized_text: The application shall include a 'Print Queue' user interface. This view must display all submitted print jobs with their current status (e.g., Queued, Processing, Completed, Failed). Standard users shall be able to cancel their own jobs if they are in a 'Queued' state. Administrators shall have the ability to view all jobs, cancel any job, and re-prioritize jobs in the queue.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall provide a "Print Queue" UI view. This view shall display the status of all submitted print jobs (e.g., Queued, Processing, Completed, Failed). Users shall be able to cancel their own pending print jobs. Admin users shall be able to view, cancel, and re-prioritize any print job in the queue.

formalized_text: When a print job fails, the system must update its status in the Print Queue to 'Failed' and display a descriptive reason for the failure (e.g., 'Printer is offline'). The UI must provide an option for the user to retry sending the failed job to the printer.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: If a print job fails (e.g., printer offline, out of paper), the system shall mark the job as 'Failed' and provide a reason for the failure in the queue view. Users shall be able to retry a failed print job from the queue.

formalized_text: The system's background service shall function as a DICOM C-STORE Service Class Provider (SCP). It must listen for incoming associations on a port configurable by an Administrator. Upon receiving a study, it shall automatically store the DICOM files in a local folder determined by configurable routing rules.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall be able to act as a C-STORE SCP, listening on a configurable port for incoming studies. Incoming studies received via C-STORE shall be automatically routed to predefined local folders.

formalized_text: The application shall function as a DICOM C-FIND and C-MOVE Service Class User (SCU). It must provide a UI for users to query a configured remote PACS using Study Date, Modality, and Patient ID as search criteria. From the search results, users must be able to select one or more studies and initiate a C-MOVE request to retrieve them to the local storage. The UI must provide real-time feedback on the C-MOVE operation's status, including progress, success, or failure with a descriptive error message.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall be able to act as a C-FIND and C-MOVE SCU. Users shall be able to query a configured PACS by Study Date, Modality, or Patient ID. Users shall be able to initiate a C-MOVE request to retrieve selected studies from the PACS to the local storage. The system shall provide clear user feedback on the status of C-MOVE operations...

formalized_text: An Administrator shall be able to configure auto-routing rules for incoming C-STORE studies via a dedicated UI in the Settings page. A rule must consist of criteria (e.g., matching a specific sending AE Title or Modality tag) and a corresponding destination folder path. The system shall evaluate these rules to determine where to store incoming DICOM files.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The criteria for auto-routing incoming studies shall be configurable by an Admin user. The Settings Page shall provide a UI for creating routing rules. A routing rule shall be definable based on criteria such as the sending AE Title, Modality, or other specified DICOM tags. Each rule shall specify a destination folder path.

formalized_text: An Administrator shall be able to manage all remote PACS configurations through a dedicated UI in the Settings page. This interface must support adding, editing, and removing PACS entries. For each entry, the Admin must be able to configure the AE Title, IP Address, Port, and supported services (C-STORE, C-FIND, C-MOVE). A 'Verify' button must be provided to perform a DICOM C-ECHO verification against the selected configuration and display the result.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Admin users shall add, remove, and edit PACS server configurations via the application's Settings Page. ... The UI shall allow configuration of AE Title, IP Address, Port, and capabilities (C-STORE, C-FIND, C-MOVE) for each PACS. The UI shall provide a "Verify" button that performs a C-ECHO test to the selected PACS configuration.

formalized_text: The system's logging mechanism, implemented with Serilog, shall write to two destinations: a local rolling text file and the Windows Event Log. The system must ensure that any Protected Health Information (PHI), such as Patient Name or Patient ID, is masked or redacted before being written to any log destination.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Application logs shall be written to a local file and the Windows Event Log. Any PHI (e.g., Patient Name, Patient ID) written to logs shall be masked (e.g., "PatientName: ******").

formalized_text: The application shall be secured by a mandatory user login screen. After successful authentication, the application's user interface and available features must be dynamically adjusted based on the logged-in user's assigned role (Technician or Administrator), strictly enforcing the defined permissions.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall require user login for access. UI elements and features shall be enabled or disabled based on the logged-in user's role as defined in the permissions matrix (Section 2.4).

formalized_text: The application must implement an automatic session lock feature. After 15 minutes of user inactivity (no keyboard or mouse input), the application shall display a lock screen overlay that covers the entire UI. The user's current state, including any open studies or work in progress, must be preserved. To resume, the user must re-enter their password to unlock the session.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application session shall automatically lock after 15 minutes of no keyboard or mouse input. When the session locks, the application shall display a lock screen overlay. The current application state... shall be preserved behind the lock screen. The user shall be required to re-enter their password to unlock the session...

formalized_text: The system shall enforce a system-wide password policy for all user accounts, configurable by an Administrator. The configurable parameters must include: minimum password length (default 12), complexity requirements (uppercase, lowercase, number, symbol), expiration period in days (e.g., 90), and the number of previous passwords to remember to prevent reuse (default 5).
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall enforce a configurable password policy for all user accounts. ...Configurable policy settings shall include: Minimum password length (Default: 12). Complexity requirements... Password expiration period... Password history count...

formalized_text: When an Administrator resets a user's password, the system must generate a secure, temporary password. Upon the user's next login attempt with this temporary password, the system must immediately force them to create a new, permanent password that adheres to the current password policy.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: When an Admin resets a user's password, the system shall generate a temporary password and require the user to set a new password upon their next login.

formalized_text: The application shall feature a metadata viewing panel that displays all DICOM tags for a selected image or series. The tags shall be organized into logical groups (e.g., Patient, Study, Series, Equipment). This panel must include a search/filter bar that allows the user to find specific tags by their name (e.g., 'Patient Name') or tag number (e.g., '(0010,0010)').
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall provide a dedicated panel to display the metadata of the selected image or series. Metadata shall be grouped by category: Patient, Study, Series, and Equipment. The metadata viewer shall include a search bar to allow filtering metadata for specific tags by name or tag number (e.g., (0010,0010)).

formalized_text: The ability to edit DICOM metadata shall be restricted to users with the Administrator role. When an Administrator initiates an edit session, the system must automatically create a 'working copy' of all files in the study. All subsequent edits will be performed on this working copy, leaving the original files untouched.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Only users with the Admin role shall be able to enter edit mode for metadata. Entering edit mode shall automatically create a 'working copy' of the study's files, as defined in REQ-NFR-003, to ensure original files are never modified.

formalized_text: An Administrator shall be able to configure which DICOM tags are editable within the application. The Settings page must provide a user interface where an Admin can add or remove specific DICOM tags from a system-wide 'editable tags' list.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The list of DICOM tags that are editable shall be configurable by an Admin user. The Settings Page shall include a UI for Admins to add or remove DICOM tags from an "editable" list.

formalized_text: The system shall maintain a comprehensive audit trail of all significant events. This includes logging every modification to DICOM metadata, changes to file state, and all user account management actions. For DICOM tag edits, the log entry must include the user's ID, a timestamp, the tag that was changed, its original value, and its new value.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: All modifications to DICOM metadata, file state, and user accounts shall be recorded in an audit trail. Every change to a DICOM tag shall be logged with the user's ID, a timestamp, the original value, and the new value.

formalized_text: The audit trail must specifically log all file state change events related to the 'working copy' feature. The events to be logged are 'Working Copy Created', 'Working Copy Modifications Saved', and 'Working Copy Discarded'. Each log entry must include the ID of the user who performed the action and a precise timestamp.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The audit trail shall also log file state change events, including 'Working Copy Created', 'Working Copy Modifications Saved', and 'Working Copy Discarded', with the user's ID and a timestamp.

formalized_text: All user account management actions performed by an Administrator must be recorded in the audit trail. This includes the creation of new users, deletion of users, changes to a user's assigned role, and password resets.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The audit trail shall log all user account management events, including user creation, deletion, role changes, and password resets, initiated by an administrator.

formalized_text: An Administrator-only 'Audit Trail' viewer shall be provided within the Settings page. This interface must display the audit logs in a human-readable format and provide controls to filter the logs by user and by date range. An 'Export to CSV' button must be available to export the currently filtered view of the audit trail to a CSV file.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall provide an interface for Admin users to review and export the audit trail. An "Audit Trail" section in the Settings Page shall display the modification logs in a readable format. The audit trail viewer shall support filtering by user and date range. The audit trail viewer shall provide an "Export to CSV" button to save the filtered log data.

formalized_text: The DICOM viewer shall be capable of rendering both monochrome and color DICOM images. It must support multi-frame series, allowing the user to scroll through individual frames. The viewer shall automatically apply appropriate, modality-specific rendering presets upon loading an image, such as default window/level settings for CT and color inversion for certain X-ray types.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The viewer shall be able to render both monochrome and color DICOM images. The viewer shall support multi-frame series (e.g., CT/MRI/US), allowing users to scroll through frames. The viewer shall correctly apply modality-specific rendering protocols, such as default windowing for CT and inversion for X-rays.

formalized_text: The DICOM viewer's rendering pipeline shall be GPU-accelerated using DirectX for improved performance. When loading large image series, the viewer must use a progressive loading strategy: it shall first display a downsampled, low-resolution preview to ensure immediate responsiveness, and then load the full-resolution image data in the background or on-demand as the user interacts with the image (e.g., zooms in).
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The viewer shall support GPU-accelerated rendering using DirectX. For large series, the viewer shall employ progressive loading, initially displaying a downsampled preview of the images and loading full-resolution data on-demand as the user scrolls or zooms.

formalized_text: The DICOM viewer UI must include a side-by-side comparison mode for displaying two series simultaneously. While in this mode, the system shall provide an option to synchronize panning, zooming, and scrolling actions across both viewports. The viewer must also include a thumbnail grid panel that displays all images in the current series, allowing for quick navigation.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The viewer UI shall provide a side-by-side comparison mode. When in comparison mode, scroll and zoom actions shall be synchronizable between the two viewports. The viewer UI shall display a thumbnail grid for easy navigation within a series.

formalized_text: The system shall allow users to import DICOM studies by dragging and dropping files or folders from Windows Explorer onto the main application window. It shall also provide a feature to export selected images or entire series into non-DICOM formats (JPEG or PNG), with an option to configure the output resolution.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Users shall be able to import DICOM files by dragging and dropping them from local folders, CDs, USB drives, or network shares onto the application window. Users shall be able to export selected images or series to non-DICOM formats (JPEG/PNG) with configurable resolution.

formalized_text: During a file import, the system must check if the Study Instance UID of an incoming study already exists in the local database. If a duplicate is found, the system must halt the import for that study and present the user with a modal dialog offering three choices: 'Overwrite' (replace the existing study), 'Discard' (cancel the import for this study), or 'Save as New' (import the study after generating a new, unique Study Instance UID for it).
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall handle cases where an imported study's UID already exists in the local database. Upon detecting a duplicate Study Instance UID during import, the system shall prompt the user with a dialog. The dialog shall provide three options: "Overwrite" the existing study, "Discard" the import, or "Save as New" (which generates a new UID for the imported study).

formalized_text: The system shall store all local DICOM files in a hierarchical folder structure defined as: `[Configured Storage Path]\[PatientID]\[StudyInstanceUID]\[SeriesInstanceUID]`. The application's local storage browser must provide search functionality based on DICOM tags, including at a minimum: Patient Name, Study Date, and Modality.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Local storage of DICOM files shall follow a hierarchical structure: `[StoragePath]\[PatientID]\[StudyUID]\[SeriesUID]`. The UI shall support tag-based search by Patient Name, Study Date, and Modality.

formalized_text: The file import process must include a DICOM compliance validation step. The system shall check for a valid file header and the presence of essential tags. Any file that fails this validation shall be rejected and not imported. Upon completion of the import operation, the system shall provide the user with a summary report detailing which files, if any, were rejected and the reason for each rejection.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: During import, the system shall verify DICOM compliance (e.g., valid header, required tags) and reject non-compliant files, providing a report of which files were rejected and why.

formalized_text: The system shall implement a scheduled background task that performs periodic data integrity checks on the local DICOM storage. This task must iterate through the database records and verify that the corresponding DICOM file exists at its expected location on the file system. Any discrepancies (e.g., missing files) must be logged and summarized in a report available to Administrators.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall include a scheduled background task to periodically verify the integrity of the local storage, checking for file existence against database records and reporting any discrepancies.

formalized_text: An Administrator must be able to configure the primary storage path for DICOM files in the Settings page, supporting both local paths (e.g., 'D:\DICOM') and UNC paths (e.g., '\\server\share'). The UI must include a 'Test' button that, when clicked, verifies write permissions to the specified path by creating and then deleting a temporary file, providing immediate success or failure feedback to the Admin.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: An Admin user shall be able to specify any Windows-accessible storage location (local path, UNC path) for DICOM files via the Settings Page. The Settings Page shall provide a "Test" button next to the storage path input field. ...the system shall attempt to write a temporary file... verify its creation, and then delete it.

formalized_text: The DICOM viewer shall provide a standard set of image manipulation tools, including: zoom (from 10% to 800%), rotation (in 90-degree increments and free 0-360 degree rotation), pan, flip (horizontal and vertical), and interactive window/level (WW/WL) adjustment. The viewer must also provide a selection of common WW/WL presets (e.g., Lung, Bone, Brain).
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The viewer shall provide a zoom functionality supporting a range from 10% to 800%. The viewer shall provide rotation functionality in 90-degree increments and free rotation (0-360 degrees). The viewer shall provide Pan and Flip (horizontal/vertical) tools. The viewer shall provide Window Level (WW/WL) adjustment that can be controlled interactively. The viewer shall provide WW/WL presets (e.g., Lung, Bone).

formalized_text: The system shall allow users to create non-destructive annotations and measurements on images. Available tools must include arrows, text boxes, and Regions of Interest (ROI). Measurement tools for length, angle, and area must be provided, and their results shall be displayed in real-world units (mm/cm) derived from the DICOM metadata. All created annotations and measurements must be saved by creating a new DICOM Grayscale Softcopy Presentation State (GSPS) object that is associated with the original image series.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall support creating non-destructive annotations and measurements. Users shall be able to draw arrows, add text, and define Regions of Interest (ROI). The system shall provide measurement tools for length, angle, and area. Measurements shall display units (mm/cm) derived from the DICOM metadata. All annotations and measurements shall be saved as separate DICOM Grayscale Softcopy Presentation State (GSPS) objects, linked to the original series.

formalized_text: The system shall support the creation and use of hanging protocols. Each user must be able to define and save their own custom display layouts (e.g., a 2x2 grid, a 1+3 comparison view) for later use.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall support customizable display layouts (hanging protocols). Users shall be able to define and save custom layouts (e.g., 2x2, 1+3) on a per-user basis.

formalized_text: Hanging protocols shall be applicable both manually and automatically. Any user shall be able to manually select one of their saved protocols from a dropdown list in the viewer. Additionally, an Administrator shall be able to configure system-wide rules that automatically apply a specific hanging protocol when a study is opened, based on matching criteria such as the study's Modality and Body Part Examined tags.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Hanging protocols shall be triggerable automatically or selectable manually. An Admin shall be able to configure rules to automatically apply a hanging protocol when a study is opened, based on matching Modality and Body Part Examined tags. A user shall be able to manually select a saved hanging protocol from a dropdown list in the viewer.

formalized_text: The application shall provide keyboard shortcuts for common actions to improve user efficiency. This must include `Ctrl+P` to open the Print Preview window and `Ctrl+W` to activate the interactive Window/Level tool. Other common actions like Zoom and Pan shall also have corresponding shortcuts.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall support keyboard shortcuts for common actions. The application shall use `Ctrl+P` to open the Print Preview window. The application shall use `Ctrl+W` to activate the Window Level (WW/WL) tool.

formalized_text: The system shall provide a DICOM metadata anonymization feature that creates a new, de-identified copy of a study while leaving the original files unmodified. The feature must offer: a manual mode for selecting specific tags to remove; a 'Basic De-ID' profile; a 'Full De-ID' profile compliant with HIPAA Safe Harbor; and a pseudonymization option to replace Patient ID with a hashed value. Upon completion, the system must generate a summary report detailing the changes made.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall provide tools to remove or replace PHI from DICOM metadata. ...preset profiles: "Basic De-ID"... and "Full De-ID"... pseudonymization option... Anonymization actions shall create new DICOM files, leaving the original files untouched. ...generate a summary report...

formalized_text: The system shall provide a pixel anonymization feature allowing users to permanently burn blackout shapes or text into image pixel data. This action must be non-destructive to the original data; it shall create a new DICOM series containing the modified images, leaving the original series untouched.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall allow users to apply permanent, destructive overlays of shapes or text on image pixels to mask identifiers. This action shall create a new, anonymized DICOM series and shall not modify the original file. ...Executing the pixel anonymization shall save a new set of DICOM files with the modifications.

formalized_text: A user management interface, accessible only to Administrators, shall be provided. This interface must support the full lifecycle of user account management, including: creating new users (specifying username, initial password, and role), editing existing users (changing roles, resetting passwords), and deleting user accounts.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: A UI shall be provided for Admins to manage user accounts. Admins shall be able to create new user accounts, specifying a username, password, and role. Admins shall be able to edit existing users, including resetting passwords and changing roles. Admins shall be able to delete user accounts.

formalized_text: The Administration area shall include a user interface for configuring automated database backups. An Administrator must be able to enable and schedule daily backups and specify a target location (either a local or UNC path) where the backup files will be stored.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The Administration area shall provide a UI for configuring automated database backups. An Admin user shall be able to schedule automated daily backups. The UI shall allow the Admin to specify a target backup location (local or UNC path).

formalized_text: The system shall provide user-specific preference settings. Each user shall be able to customize their default color for annotations and create and save their own custom window/level (WW/WL) presets for personal use.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Individual users shall be able to customize their experience. Users shall be able to customize their default annotation colors. Users shall be able to create and save their own default windowing presets.

formalized_text: The application's user interface shall be modern and intuitive, leveraging the Material Design in XAML Toolkit. It must provide personalization options including a toggle switch for Light and Dark themes, and a dedicated high-contrast mode designed to meet WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The UI shall be clean, modern, and intuitive... A toggle switch shall be available for users to switch between a Dark and Light theme. The application shall provide a high-contrast mode to comply with WCAG 2.1 AA for low-vision users.

formalized_text: The application must be fully accessible via keyboard. Users shall be able to navigate between and interact with all UI controls using standard keyboard commands (Tab, Shift+Tab, Enter, Arrow keys). To aid usability, all interactive controls (buttons, input fields, etc.) must display a descriptive tooltip on mouse hover.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall be fully navigable using a keyboard (e.g., Tab, Shift+Tab, Enter, Arrow keys). All interactive UI controls shall provide tooltips on hover.

formalized_text: The system must provide clear and consistent feedback to the user. For long-running, synchronous operations like file import/export, a progress indicator must be displayed. For asynchronous background tasks like printing, the system shall use non-blocking toast notifications to inform the user of the eventual success or failure of the operation.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall provide consistent user feedback for actions, including progress indicators for long-running operations (e.g., import, export) and non-blocking toast notifications for success or failure of background tasks.

formalized_text: The application shall implement a specific license validation workflow. On startup, it will contact the Odoo API. If network connectivity fails, it will enter a fully functional 72-hour grace period. If the API returns an invalid license status, or if the grace period expires without a successful validation, the application must enter a restricted, read-only mode where functions like printing, exporting, and receiving new studies are disabled.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: License Validation Workflow: On application startup, the system shall attempt to validate its license against the Odoo API. ...gracefully handle specific HTTP error codes... If the license cannot be validated due to network unavailability, the application shall enter a grace period of 72 hours... If the license is confirmed as invalid or the grace period expires, the application shall switch to a restricted, read-only mode.

formalized_text: All network communication with the Odoo licensing API must be encrypted using Transport Layer Security (TLS). The system shall enforce a minimum of TLS 1.2 and shall be configured to prefer TLS 1.3 if supported by the server.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: All communication with the Odoo licensing API shall use TLS 1.2 or higher. The system shall be configured to prefer TLS 1.3 where supported by both client and server.

formalized_text: The application shall be supported on Windows 10 (version 20H2 or later) and Windows 11. The minimum required hardware specification is a 64-bit, 2 GHz processor and 8 GB of RAM. For optimal performance, 16 GB of RAM is recommended.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall operate on Windows 10 (Version 20H2 or later) or Windows 11. The system shall require a minimum hardware configuration of an x64-based, 2 GHz or faster processor. The system shall require a minimum of 8 GB of RAM; 16 GB is recommended.

formalized_text: The MSIX installer must include a prerequisite check step. During installation, it shall prompt the user for PostgreSQL and RabbitMQ connection details and attempt to establish a connection. Installation shall not be allowed to complete if connectivity to either service fails. The PostgreSQL check must also specifically verify that the `pgcrypto` extension is enabled on the target database.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The installer shall perform prerequisite checks for connectivity to the required PostgreSQL and RabbitMQ services and shall prevent installation from completing if connectivity cannot be established with user-provided connection details. The installer's prerequisite check for PostgreSQL shall verify that the `pgcrypto` extension is installed and enabled on the target database.

formalized_text: The system must meet the following performance targets on a machine meeting the recommended hardware specifications: application launch time shall be less than 3 seconds on an SSD (5 seconds on an HDD); loading a DICOM study up to 500MB shall take less than 3 seconds; and UI response time for common actions (e.g., button clicks) shall be under 500ms, even during background processing.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall launch in under 5 seconds on an HDD. The application shall launch in under 3 seconds on an SSD. The system shall load DICOM images up to 500MB in size within 3 seconds on standard hardware. UI responsiveness for user-initiated actions... shall be under 500ms...

formalized_text: The system's C-STORE SCP, utilizing the decoupled database insertion architecture, must be capable of handling at least 10 simultaneous incoming C-STORE associations without causing noticeable degradation in the responsiveness of the client UI.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application shall handle at least 10 simultaneous C-STORE operations without significant degradation in UI responsiveness.

formalized_text: All potentially long-running operations initiated from the UI thread, such as file I/O and network requests (C-FIND, C-MOVE, license checks), must be executed asynchronously using the `async/await` pattern to ensure the UI thread is never blocked and the application remains responsive.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: All other long-running tasks (file I/O, network requests) shall be executed asynchronously using `async/await` to keep the UI responsive at all times.

formalized_text: The system must guarantee the integrity of original DICOM data. Standard operations like viewing, printing, and creating GSPS annotations shall never alter the original files. Any action that modifies DICOM data itself, such as metadata editing or pixel anonymization, must be performed on a separate 'working copy' of the study, leaving the original files in their pristine state.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The system shall ensure that original DICOM files are never modified by viewing, printing, or annotation operations. Modification actions, including metadata editing and anonymization, shall create a working copy of the original files, leaving the original files untouched.

formalized_text: The system shall persist unsaved 'working copies'. If the application is closed while a study has unsaved modifications, the working copy files must not be deleted. When any user subsequently opens that same study, the application must detect the persisted working copy and prompt the user with a choice to either 'Continue with unsaved changes' (loading the working copy) or 'Discard changes' (deleting the working copy and loading the original).
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Working Copy Persistence: If a user closes the application while a study has an unsaved working copy, the working copy files shall be persisted. Upon the next time any user opens that same study, the application shall present a modal dialog prompting the user to either "Continue with unsaved changes" or "Discard changes".

formalized_text: All user passwords must be stored in the database as salted hashes. The system shall use the BCrypt algorithm for all password hashing and verification operations.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: User passwords shall be stored in the database using a strong, salted hashing algorithm (BCrypt).

formalized_text: The system must enforce encryption for data in transit and at rest. All connections to the PostgreSQL server must use TLS. Within the database, all columns containing PHI must be encrypted using the `pgcrypto` extension. Furthermore, the database server itself must have full-disk encryption enabled as a deployment requirement.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: All network connections from the application to the PostgreSQL database server shall be encrypted using TLS. Data at rest within the PostgreSQL database shall be encrypted. PHI-containing columns shall be encrypted using the `pgcrypto` extension. Full-disk encryption on the database server is also required.

formalized_text: The application must not store any sensitive credentials (e.g., database passwords, SMTP credentials, API keys) in plaintext configuration files. All such secrets shall be stored securely using the Windows Credential Manager.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: All sensitive credentials, including those for the database, SMTP server, and external APIs, shall be stored securely using the Windows Credential Manager and not in plaintext configuration files.

formalized_text: An automated dependency vulnerability scan using OWASP Dependency-Check or a similar tool shall be integrated into the development and build pipeline. This process must be used to identify and mitigate security risks associated with third-party libraries.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The development lifecycle shall include automated dependency vulnerability scanning using OWASP Dependency-Check to identify and mitigate risks from third-party libraries.

formalized_text: The background Windows Service shall be configured to restart automatically in the event of an unexpected termination or crash. The service's recovery options in Windows shall be set to 'Restart the Service' for the first, second, and subsequent failures.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The background Windows Service shall be configured for automatic restart on failure.

formalized_text: The application user interface must be internationalized to support multiple languages. For Phase 1, all UI text shall be available in both English (default) and Spanish. The application should provide a mechanism for the user to switch between supported languages.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: The application UI shall support English (default) and Spanish for UI text in Phase 1.

formalized_text: The system's backup and recovery strategy must support a Recovery Point Objective (RPO) of 24 hours and a Recovery Time Objective (RTO) of 4 hours. The Administrator's Guide must contain detailed, step-by-step procedures for both backing up the PostgreSQL database using standard tools (e.g., `pg_dump`) and restoring it from a backup.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Data Backup and Recovery: The system shall have a defined Recovery Point Objective (RPO) of 24 hours. The system shall have a defined Recovery Time Objective (RTO) of 4 hours. The administrative documentation must include a detailed, step-by-step backup procedure... and a corresponding restore procedure.

formalized_text: Two key documents shall be delivered with the system: a Deployment Guide and an Administrator's Guide. The Deployment Guide will focus on installation and initial configuration of the application and its prerequisites. The Administrator's Guide will cover all day-to-day administrative tasks, such as user management, system configuration, and monitoring.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: A separate deployment guide and a consolidated Administrator's Guide shall be provided for system administrators.

formalized_text: To facilitate debugging and tracing, the system shall generate a unique correlation ID for every user-initiated asynchronous operation (such as printing or C-MOVE). This correlation ID must be included in all log entries related to that specific operation, from the initial client request, through the message queue, to the final processing in the background service.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: For each user-initiated asynchronous operation (e.g., print, C-MOVE), a unique correlation ID shall be generated and included in all related log entries across the client, message queue, and background service to facilitate end-to-end tracing.

formalized_text: The Administration area shall feature a System Health Dashboard that displays the real-time status of critical system components. This dashboard must include indicators for: Windows Service status (Running/Stopped), PostgreSQL connectivity, RabbitMQ connectivity, the current number of messages in the main processing queue, the number of messages in the dead-letter queue, and the available disk space at the configured DICOM storage location, with configurable warning thresholds.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: System Health Dashboard: The Administration area shall contain a system health dashboard. The dashboard shall display the real-time status of key components: Windows Service (Running/Stopped). Connectivity to PostgreSQL (Connected/Disconnected). Connectivity to RabbitMQ (Connected/Disconnected). Current message queue depth... Number of messages in the dead-letter queue. Available disk space for the configured DICOM storage path...

formalized_text: The system shall implement a critical error alerting mechanism. An Administrator must be able to configure a recipient email address for alerts. The system shall automatically send an alert email to this address whenever a critical error is written to the Windows Event Log or when a metric on the System Health Dashboard (e.g., disk space) crosses its configured critical threshold.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: Critical Error Alerting: The system shall provide a mechanism for an Admin to configure an administrator email address for alerts. When a critical error is logged to the Windows Event Log, or a monitored metric on the health dashboard crosses a critical threshold, the system shall automatically send an alert email to the configured address.

formalized_text: A standalone data migration utility shall be provided to facilitate the transition from the legacy system. This utility must be capable of migrating both study metadata and the corresponding DICOM files. The process must follow an Extract, Transform, Load, and Validate (ETLV) pattern, generating detailed logs and a final validation report comparing record counts to ensure data integrity.
feature_group: DICOM Management and Printing System - Core
original_text: A dedicated data migration utility shall be provided to migrate study metadata and DICOM files from the legacy system. The migration process shall follow an Extract, Transform, Load, and Validate (ETLV) sequence.
